bach.DataFrame.set_index¶

DataFrame.set_index(keys, append=False, drop=True, inplace=False)[source]¶

Set this dataframe’s index to the the index given in keys

Parameters

  • keys (Union[str, Series, List[Union[str, Series]]]) – the keys of the new index. Can be a column name str, a Series, or a list of those. If Series are passed, they should have the same base node as the DataFrame they are set on.

  • append (bool) – whether to append to the existing index or replace.

  • drop (bool) – delete columns to be used as the new index.

  • inplace (bool) – update the current DataFrame or return a new DataFrame. This is not always supported and will raise if it is not.

Returns

a DataFrame with the new index or None if inplace=True.

Return type

Optional[DataFrame]
